newsitem.title: USA: Roberts Pharmaceutical sells two products.
newsitem.headline: Roberts Pharmaceutical sells two products.

text.p: Roberts Pharmaceutical Corp said on Thursday Monarch Pharmaceuticals, a unit of Tennessee-based King Pharmaceuticals, bought two of its respiratory care product lines for an undisclosed sum.
The company said in a statement Monarch acquired Nucofed, for cough and congestion relief, and Quibron, used to relieve asthma and bronchospasm symptoms.
Nucofed and Quibron lines each consisted of four separate dosage forms.

Robert Vukovich, president and chief executive officer said: "The sale of these two product lines is in keeping with Roberts plans to divest certain brands in order to concentrate on the commercialization of our pipeline."

He said ProAmatine, a cardiovascular agent, was recently cleared for U.S. marketing, and is now being labeled and packaged for shipment. Agrelin, its drug for excessive blood platelet levels, was also making progress towards its approval, Vukovich said.
